All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    Config
    The class manages the configuration and running of a simulation.
    CPU
    A CPU object stores the currently executing process, provides a method for performing context switches, and records the number of context switches that have occurred during execution.
    CPUInstruction
    Abstract representation of a block of program code describing a cpu burst.
    Event
    Abstract class Event - write a description of the class here
    EventHandler<E extends Event>  
    EventQueue
    Ordered Event queue for discrete event simulator.
    EventScheduler
    Implementation of EventScheduler
    ExecveEvent
    An Execve event represents the creation of a program execution.
    FCFSKernel
    Concrete Kernel type
    Instruction
    Representation of program instruction in abstract.
    InterruptHandler
    Interface for a kernel that handles interrupts such as timeouts and completion of device I/O operations.
    IODevice
    Simulation of an IO device.
    IOInstruction
    Abstract representation of a block of program code describing an I/O burst.
    Kernel
    Interface to the simulated kernel.
    ProcessControlBlock
    Abstract Description of Process Control Block used by kernel and simulator.
    ProcessControlBlock.State
    Possible process states.
    ProcessControlBlock.Transition  
    ProcessControlBlockImpl
    Implementation of abstract ProcessControlBlock type.
    Profile
    An object of this class represents the execution profile of a process.
    Profiler
    Record of time spent in each process state.
    RoundRobinKernel
    Concrete Kernel type
    SimulateFCFS
    Simulation of FCFS Scheduling.
    SimulateRR
    Write a description of class main here.
    SimulationClock
    Implementation of SystemTimer type.
    SystemCall
    System call interface for OS kernel.
    SystemTimer
    A SystemTimer (i) provides support for simulated time, and (ii) support for the setting of timeout interrupts by kernel code.
    TimeOutEvent
    A timeout event is used to flag the end of the current execution time slice.
    TRACE
    Controller for execution tracing.
    WakeUpEvent
    A WakeUp event occurs when an I/O operation completes.
